title: Tawakkol Karman | Biography, Nobel Prize, and Facts | Britannica

quotes: Tawakkol Karman (born February 7, 1979, Taʿizz, Yemen) is a Yemeni women’s rights activist who received the Nobel Peace Prize in 2011 for her role in leading a pro-democracy protest movement.
her father, ʿAbd al-Salām Karmān, a lawyer, served as minister of legal affairs before resigning in 1994 over the government’s war against secessionists in southern Yemen.
She graduated from the University of Science and Technology in Sanaa with a degree in commerce in 1999 and later earned a master’s degree in political science.

Tawakkol Karman (born February 7, 1979, Taʿizz, Yemen) is a Yemeni women’s rights activist who received the Nobel Peace Prize in 2011 for her role in leading a pro-democracy protest movement.

When she was young, her family moved to Sanaa, where her father, ʿAbd al-Salām Karmān, a lawyer, served as minister of legal affairs before resigning in 1994 over the government’s war against secessionists in southern Yemen.
